review_title: Benefits are good, Management is lacking, good for experience.
pros:
* 400 hours of PTO (You occur between 7-9 hours per check depending on years worked there)
* 200+ hours of Sick Leave (Gained at a much slower rate, but similar to PTO in that you gain more the more years you work here)
* Employee benefits package as a single person is around $50-60/mo (around 25 per check) and includes Dental, Vision, and normal benefits like you would see with other companies.
* Depending on department, very relaxed policies. (Ex. my department people literally come in super late all the time or make it a normal occurrence, and also leave early)
cons:
* Management - This one is also dependent on department but its not just the management itself its the decisions made. You will see a lot of movement of people getting promotions but not ones you expect. A lot of people who get promoted are promoted based on favoritism, not how well the person would actually full fill the job.
* SDA favoritism - You will see that SDA (Seventh Day Adventist) members in most departments get a ton of leniency in terms of everything. In my current department we have had SDA members literally sit around and talk while others work and they do not get in trouble. It is also widely known among employees that SDA members get a lot of special treatment.

pros: Option to go to chapel on Wednesday's. My boss allowed me to make my own hours.
cons: Pay was low. Not very open to new ideas when it came to workflow. "This is always been the way we do it" was often heard.

pros: Pay was mediocre. Staff was chill.
cons: Management was the worst. Orientation is in Loma Linda. They fire you over the phone, and ask why you missed a month and a half of work.

review_title: Great environment, decent pay, but questionable practices
job_title: Systems Analyst in Loma Linda, CA
pros:
- Pay is decent. Not the best but not the worst.
- Work Environment is great, everyone tries to get a long.
- Benefits are great, and vacation time is abundant compared to most other places.
- Opportunities to move up
cons:
- Hiring or promotions can be questionable sometimes. The decisions on who is fit for a position is not weighed by a persons skill set or ability to perform the job, but sometimes who they know and if they are liked. This leads to issues of the person being able to perform their future duties adequately, and has been seen more often then you would like.

- Employees are not held accountable for work related issues or mistakes on the job. A lot of the time other employees are told to cover for the other persons lack of work ethic or mistakes. This is an example of every department wanting to be seen as perfect with no faults. 

- There is a drastic difference in skill sets for some employees within the same job duties. This has to do with my first point.

pros: you can learn a lot
cons: work life balance can be challenging

pros: -if you value providing patient care to vulnerable populations, this could be a pro
cons:
As mentioned by another employee post, there is a lot of pettiness,favoritism, and gossip.  Professionalism and accountability are afterthoughts. Many vulnerable patients are treated with disrespect, and mistreated by staff and health "professionals" alike (medically unnecessary procedures performed to increase revenues, patient privacy violations, negligence). Residents, medical students, and medical support staff get mistreated and abused like circus animals performing a show of patient centered service and their thankless hard work cons patients into making return appointments only to find out that their beloved caregivers have left for greener pastures (which happens very often), and that their visits, no matter how dissatisfying,  fuel the money machine that is LLU.  LOW PAY, FOR HIGH WORK LOADS, IN AVERAGE OR BELOW AVERAGE CONDITIONS = WASTE OF TIME, OPPORTUNITY COSTS, AND OVERALL REDUCED EARNINGS. LLU health benefits aren't as good as other companies. Old facilities with outdated medical equipment compromises patient care and patient service. Patients are more likely to shop around for healthcare services, and LLU IS A 2 STAR JOKE compared to other healthcare facilities. SHOP AROUND FOR BETTER EMPLOYMENT, or you'll regret it when you let time fly by, and you're cornered in by the low wage, lack of trustworthy support, and outdated skills because you're using outdated equipment. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND A LOVED ONE TO WORK HERE.
LIFE IS TOO SHORT TO GET SHORT SIGHTED AND SHORT CHANGED BY LLU!

pros: Health insurance benefits are good.
cons: Not good paying employer, too hard on management with no gratification

review_title: Fun and flexible environment, but not much room for growth
job_title: Computer Support Specialist in Loma Linda, CA
pros:
* Educational institution that cares about its faculty, staff, and students.
* Laid-back atmosphere and environment.
* Flexible hours as long as work is not neglected.
* Very good benefits at low cost for entire family.
* Lots of opportunities to cross-train and learn new skills.
* Continuing education is encouraged and supported.
* Stable environment where turn-over is very low.
* Proper ergonomics are encouraged and supported, with on-staff specialists available for ergonomic evaluations.
cons:
* As a non-profit educational institution, base pay is not as high as many for-profit private companies.
* Not much room for professional growth in I.T. in spite of the encouragements to attend college and other training courses.
* Greater importance and emphasis by the CIO is given to the programming groups than to the I.T. support staff instead of both being equal.
* The low turn-over is partly due to an extreme unwillingness to release low-output employees.
* As a religious institution it is impossible to reach the executive staff levels as a person that is not Seventh-Day Adventist.
* Annual evaluations can be given up to half a year late, though if a pay raise is given, back-pay will also be given.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great clinical experience, good case work.
cons: If you do not fit within their little bubble they will not only treat you like crap but will do it with a smile on their faces. people were purposely  going out of their way to sabotage any chance I had to get hired on there, all because I didn't fit within their idea of what a perfect human/ employee should be, maybe they were threatened by me and my innovative ideas but that's no excuse. I was there to learn not there to be put in super dangerous situations with a preceptor who just walked out of the room or sat in the corner and was no where to be found if I happened to have a Question. luckily I am very adaptable and know how to handle myself otherwise it could of been very bad for all parties involved.

pros: Great environment in the Loma Linda community, great room to grow your skills, professional environment around doctors, nurses, and being near the hospital.
cons: The research labs are full of work-aholics, most researchers do NOT know how to teach and mentor others, they don't get along with other co-workers, most of the workers are Asian working over 40 hours a week, and it is not a healthy environment to work in, the people are angry and do not represent the Loma Linda core values and ideals. I was very surprised and disappointed with what I witnessed.

review_title: Do Not Work For This Horrible Company
pros: There is no pros with this company at all!
cons: Sick pay. Can't use sick pay if you're sick, you have to use your paid time off and if you don't have paid time off then you're out of luck. So what's the point of having sick pay if you can't use it! Don't even get paid out on your sick pay. So sick pay is basically an imagination. Benefits sucks. Give you a hard time when renewing your prescriptions. You have to make an appointment just for the doctor to tell you "oh you didn't need to make an appointment to renew your prescription" so you waste $20 for a useless visit. They treat their employees horrible. If you do an amazing job you can't get a raise unless the other person in your department gets one. So if the other person is horrible, your boss can't give you a raise because in the managements eyes it's either both get a raise or no one gets a raise. One can't get a raise while the other one gets a raise. It's so unfair. Thank god I left this horrible company.

review_title: Excellent opportunity for students to gain research experience and publications.
job_title: Research Analyst in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Very educational experience for learning statistical analysis and consulting using SAS. Tons of opportunities for publications if you are assertive and speak up. If you are the quantitative employee, expect to analyze data and manage databases. If you are the non-quantitative employee, expect to work on grant writing and literature reviews all day.
cons: It can be either a very independent experience or a very very heavily micromanaged one, and there is too often a translational gap between admins and staff. Expect to be working at odd hours and often doing "high priority" tasks out of the blue. Deadlines are never met and admins procrastinate heavily while expecting you not to miss a beat. Pay issues can come up if you aren't properly set up initially with HR, which should be your first priority.

job_title: Regulatory Coordinator in Loma Linda, CA
pros: People are very nice and the have nice Christmas decor. They work an adjusted schedule so most jobs are 8.5 hours Monday-Thursday and 6 hours Friday.
cons: Hard to get anything done. Paid leave/sick leave is a joke. Have to have 120 hours in sick leave bank before you can draw directly from it--takes about 3 years working full time to ear that. Internal website is hard to use. Facilities and policies tend to be outdated. Strongly relies on paper for research where most institutions rely on electronic submission systems. Lots of passing the buck off to others when things go wrong. No ownership unless it's to take credit for other's successes.

review_title: Not enough pay, so get them out of your way!
job_title: Senior Research Assistant in Murrieta, CA
pros: They bring in a lot of consulting (is this really a Pro or a Con?), Micro-management is not practiced within this employer, and interviews are extremely easy-going.  That's it.
cons: Inexperienced staff, horrible project management, uninformed executive management, too many problems pushed under the table which leads to incompetent revenue/funding.

review_title: Management favors those who are "lifetime friends or family" - nepotism is rampant.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Good educational experiences because it's a level 4 trauma center.  Experience here looks good on a resume.  State of the art equipment and newly remodeled atmosphere.  If your one of those that are "favored" it can't get better.
cons: Lax atmosphere sometimes leads to patient safety issues that are promptly hidden and covered up by management.  Management practices favoritism that is off the charts.  Higher management needs to do a unit/department management overhaul with respects to not only unit managers but with charge nurses, as well.  In fact, the overhaul should ESPECIALLY be with respect to the charge nurses.

job_title: Digital Production Ink in Perris, CA
pros: Good benefits,  impossible to get fired.
cons: Low pay,  impossible to move up,  surrounded by co-workers who show up and get paid but for being lazy and spending their time playing games on the computer and glued to facebook. Management doesn't care.  A few people actually work really hard to pick up everyone else's slack.  Very stressful and frustrating.

pros: There is a committed focus to wholeness, which includes being healthy, not working past sundown on Friday or on the weekends and an emphasis on the whole person. For me, this includes an emphasis on my spiritual side. Being a faith-based institution, I appreciate that we are guided by a higher mission to continue the teaching and healing ministry of Jesus.
cons: While we emphasize personal wholeness, many people wear too many hats and work very hard. This is true for a lot of places, but with a wholeness focus, LLU could be a little better about "practicing what we preach." Overall, GREAT place to work.

job_title: Web Content Manager in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Generally, people are very nice. Employees enjoy a wide variety of quality benefits that are also affordable. There are also many opportunities to volunteer and cater to personal "wholeness" in mind, body and spirit.
cons: Very poor leadership and all decisions are driven by politics - not what will create the greatest value. It's very challenging to have a significant impact or feel like your individual experience holds value.

pros: Dean of Women at Kate Lindsay Hall will work with your school schedule. You are more likely to be promoted to RA position which will give you room-rent compensation instead of hourly pay. Promotions to Full-time Resident Assistant is possible pending you show excellent time-management skills, keep in close connection with other RA's and make your desires clear with the deans.
cons: Prepare to dedicate time and effort for work related activities all days of the week. Raises are not available unless you are promoted to full time RA or student dean, where pay is compensated differently.

review_title: Loma Linda is a good employer but could be better
pros: Excellent benefits. Caring atmosphere and good people work at Loma Linda in the healthcare field.  Employees are very friendly and thoughtful to each other.  Loma Linda does wonderful things for employees, such as giveaways during open enrollment, lunches to show appreciation for jobs well done and free memberships to their health & fitness center. They treat long-term employees (such as myself) as family and do wonderful things for their employees during the holiday season.
cons:
Human Resources does not follow through on problems or questions you have as an employee.  Reps do not answer their phones and do not return your calls.  If you have a problem with anything HR-related, even if it relates to benefits, you will make numerous calls and get no results.  

You cannot advance in the clerical field if you are not a member of the Seventh Day Adventist Church.  I understand their reasoning but there is definitely a feeling that you are an outsider, and Loma Linda is now too large to continue with this practice.  Talented employees are not able to advance.  In addition, many departments have long-term managers who have been in their positions too long and are no longer productive.

Raises are based on longevity and not performance.

review_title: The leadership is confused about how to foster a good working environment.
pros: Employment, heavy work load, opportunity, cost of living to salary, parking is free
cons: Leadership is lacking though there is a lot of administration, compensation is based upon ones ability to request and ones connections to the leaderships inner circle, no promotion

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great work environment with many opportunities to collaborate with different groups on a variety of projects. Regular lecture sessions to keep everyone informed on new tech and research. SDA community is prominent and affects the overall culture at institution. Overall good environment with many from different backgrounds.
cons: SDA culture is a little imposing for people that don't practice the same faith. Pay raises were minimal and growth is somewhat limited. Some department heads are difficult to work with.

review_title: Not a good place to do research
job_title: Post Doctoral Fellow in Loma Linda, CA
pros: It is cheaper to live here and it is not crowded
cons: They take everything very serious and are not flexible AT ALL! not a good place to do a post doc research. They expect you to work like you are in a company with very limited vacation time. Very strict rule of being at the office. Also, they are religious and they do not have coffee or meat on campus

review_title: I have learned the skill of adapting to change and am a stronger person for it.
job_title: Document Imaging Specialist in San Bernardino, CA
pros: The benefits are great here. Also the relationships with co-workers & leadership team is great. The spiritual aspect of working for this health organization is wonderful.
cons: The pay for the complexity of our job skills is the lowest of surrounding healthcare facilities.

review_title: One of the best jobs ever...
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: While it may not true for all departments.  The school I worked in was very flexible in work/life balance. We were not micromanaged as long as we got our work done and put in the required hours.
cons: I personally hated doing my own evaluations. I value an honest opinion of how they think I'm doing as opposed to how I think I'm doing. Other than that, there is nothing.

job_title: Research Technician in Loma Linda, CA
pros: My boss was a great person and everyone that I worked with was very helpful and was willing to get me up to speed on everything I was lacking in.
cons:
We were being shoved out of our ability to research sufficiently due to political drama.
Loma Linda is a vegetarian place, so the food court and nearby restaurants are vegetarian.

review_title: Great work environment!  My piers appreciate my efforts, and they are always thanking me!
pros: My current boss is excellent and flexible.  Communication is great and I always get feedback from him.
cons: Benefits package: health insurance has gone up the last 3 years, along with the co-pay for medication.

review_title: Good People, Hard to Work With
pros: One of largest employers in Inland Empire. Known for significant contributions to local community and economy. Many happy employees. One of the major players in the region in medicine and health careers.
cons: Salaries are low in non-medicine jobs. Politics and culture of favored group makes satisfying employment difficult for those who are not part of the in-group. Preferences shown for members of favored group. Discriminatory hiring and promotion practices. Organization survives by too many work arounds, which frustrate any real efforts to accomplish anything. If you like endless frustrations and passive aggressive co-workers, this is the place for you.

pros: Loma Linda University is a warm and tight community of students, faculty, staff, administrators, and health care providers. It's just an overall great place to be!
cons: Loma Linda University, and its affiliated entities, are very large and diverse. I sometimes think we are too big for our britches because sometimes communication is poor across entities.

pros: Good people who genuinely enjoyed their work. Overall, very positive environment with motivated people. The organization tries to be very community-oriented, i.e. giving back to the community, helping people in the community, and you can work on interesting projects that support the local neighborhood.
cons: Being that it's connected to a church system, you may hear about church-related politics (not any one specific church, but the U.S. Adventist church system as a whole). This may be a con for some.

job_title: Web Content Writer in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Position is great for someone who is fresh out of college with little experience in writing. The organization's values and vision are worth working at Loma Linda University Health.
cons: There is nothing to move up to and the position requires very little creativity because it is mostly copy editing and answering services tickets.

review_title: A company that still cares for employees
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Loma Linda, CA
pros:
Caring Coworkers
Company does many different programs and has many features that benefit the employee. Little things like giving out pedometers to encourage walking, and putting out newsletters to let employees know what is going on are not unappreciated.
cons: There is a lot of work to get done every day and it can be very stressful.

review_title: Toxic culture of blaming and shaming
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: You get to leave early on Fridays.
cons: Horribly, horribly mismanaged. No rhyme or reason to how they behave - they do as they wish, with no consideration for employees outside of their blatantly chosen "favorites". They consistently choose not to communicate with their employees to purposely keep everyone in the dark. That's just how they roll.

review_title: Flexible and easy going work environment
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Good work environment with 20 working hours per week, which gives enough time to concentrate on your studies. Good christian and spiritual environment. Understanding bosses.
cons: They only pay you 25% of your tuition which doesn't help much in affording most of your expenses. Besides that, it is a good working and learning environment.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: It was a great experience to work as a graduate teaching assistant for some of the best teachers in Loma Linda University School of Allied Health. Lot of learning, Compliant mentors, good comfort and work environment.
cons: I did not come across any major cons that need to be addressed. There were times when sensed some amount of variations with regards to ethnicity, but again was an assumption, I could be wrong.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Loma Linda, CA
pros: It's a teaching hospital so you learn a lot. Most of the people are really nice. Working here looks good on your resume because it's a level 1 trauma center.
cons: You work tooo hard and they don't pay well enough. People don't stay so they have a high turn over rate.

review_title: It was ok, not the best place to work, not the worst either
job_title: Research Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Good community health programs, promotes work-life balance, seminars available for continuing education, they also promote volunteering activities
cons: Very nepotistic, highly conservative, might be hard to get used to if you aren't into praying/spirituality/going to chapel, private university so they favor those with similar beliefs and have preference/ protect their own.

job_title: Research Technician in Loma Linda, CA
pros: The staff are honest people, it is a good work environment. There are many opportunities to also continue your education here. It is also a religious work location because of the affection with the 7th day adventist chruch.
cons: I haven't been here long enough (half a year) to notice any cons. The people are really nice, and there are many students in the labs working on their PHD's.

review_title: Loma Linda University is a good working and study environment.
job_title: Research Analyst in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Good working environment with highly professionals personals
cons: Loma Linda University pays very little to their employees and less often your work is recognized by the University. One big issue with this organization that if you're not SDA then most likely you well experience some kind of discrimination.

job_title: Doctoral Student in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great people to work with and a wide range of biomedical research projects. There are good opportunities for clinical research in multiple fields.
cons: Research funding generally throughout the US has reduced so smaller institutions like Loma Linda University have to fihpght harder to get funding.

job_title: Research Associate in Loma Linda, CA
pros: People are generally nice and professional.  You are able to conduct some interesting research projects.
cons: There are some office politics in the lab. Some PIs are rude and unprofesional. You got to avoid them and change a lab if possible. Otherwise, you will have a miserable life.

pros: People are usually friendly and supportive. Since I work for an academic setting, things are more laid back compared to the medical center.
cons: Parking can be difficult at the university. Since it's a relatively small school, it seems like everybody knows about everyone's business.

pros: Positive atmosphere, clean campus, christian atmosphere, students from all over the country & world, great benefits.
cons: Older buildings & bathrooms.  Often takes a long time to get a position or wirk your way in to a better position (people tend to stay).

review_title: Great people, easy atmosphere, not so great compensation
job_title: Senior Programmer Analyst in Loma Linda, CA
pros:
* Nice and helpful people
* Independent work atmosphere
* remote work due to pandemic
* staggered hours (8.5 hours Mon-Thurs, 6 hr Fri.)
cons:
* lower than standard pay rate
* not so great PTO accrual (Holidays are taken out of your PTO and are not separate from your PTO)
* cut hours (2 hours lost due to pandemic)

review_title: Working for Loma Linda for a few years
pros: Great first time job or extra job. Excellent perks of working at a fitness facility, free pool use (competition pool), Gym, Intramural sports.
cons: Loma linda has really slipped as a place of employment low pay. Poor decision making on their part. Money not spent well. Little to no chance for advancement.

review_title: My experience here has changed my life positively.
pros: Great network, great team, amazing spiritual wholeness, lovely facilities, diverse team. I never have felt so connected as I have being apart of the team here.
cons: Sometimes it takes a long time to work around a seemingly small problem. Committees and meeting take a long time to make decisions.

pros: Great People to work with. Everyone is interested in the best solution for the patient. They treat each other with kindness.
cons: Low compensation. Not enough operating rooms. Fatal combination of EPIC EHR with little support in the way of Dragon Speak of scribes.

pros: Relaxed environment, Friday afternoons off, good culture, nice coworkers, good entry-level base pay, reasonable training.
cons: Some of the students can be pretty bratty. Some of the international students were disrespectful to women. Annoying, but not really the fault of the school.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Loma Linda prioritizes your health and health is wealth.  There are few other workplaces I have had that have done so much to ensure I stay healthy and happy in my job.
cons: The pay is slightly less than neighboring institutions.

job_title: Lab Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Employer and supervisor really take care of their workers. The working environment was great. All the employees were nice and worked as a team effectively and efficiently.
cons: There are some restrictions due to school's religious beliefs, such as dressing code and they only serve vegetarian food at the cafeteria.

pros: Enjoyed working with former employees and great medical insurance.
cons: Managers and above out of touch. Low pay compared to other organizations like this.

review_title: Nice experience for a beginning scientist
pros: Great experience, really good salary, all benefits imaginable, flexible work hours
cons: Not much room for growth, lonesome - unless you love being a lab rat, this is not a social person's job, monotonous sometimes, tiresome, long work hours

review_title: Too much politics not enough hard work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Accrual vacation time quickly especially after 5 years of employment.
cons: Higher positions are limited to SDAs, so you can only go up so high in this organization.

job_title: Research Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Very good exposure on how to carry out research. Experience in making presentations, posters and looking for evidence based articles. Working experience in B-ALERT EEG, TOSOH, DIAZYME etc. Point of care testing of CRP, HbA1C
cons: None that I can think of at this moment.

review_title: It's an organization that cares about it's employees.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Good cutting edge health care, the organization promotes wellness, they have a good benefits package, discounts at pharmacy.
cons: Not a good fit for someone who is not conservative. Communication between departments is not always the best.

job_title: Associate Professor in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Christian environment to work in and focused on the whole person. Friendly people and collegiate atmosphere where patients are placed first.
cons: Low compensation compared to other places. Overworked a lot of the time and seemingly no plan to address the workload.

pros:
Medical ancillary staff are very attentive to patients needs and comfort. 
Medical faculty are generally well esteemed by their patients who receive thorough clinical evaluations with proper attention placed for questions and concerns.
cons: Crowded employee parking may be an issue.

job_title: Associate Professor in Loma Linda, CA
pros: The university offers really good benefits. Faculty have access to many activities related to wholeness such as the Drayson center
cons: There are often political issues that allow students to get away with mediocre work. Most colleagues are pleasant.

pros: Great working environment, I have a great boss and I get along with my co worker.
cons: Some managerial issues. Sometimes it's difficult to move forward with a few projects because everyone needs to buy in to the project.

job_title: Coding Supervisor in San Bernardino, CA
pros: Health Insurance premium is reasonably priced. Benefits include retirement plan and tuition to LLU at low cost.
cons: Low salaries in comparison to the reset of the organization for similar positions.

review_title: It's a job not a career
pros: Great for entry level positions but do not expect to advance in your career.  Recommend you look elsewhere.
cons: Management is often self-serving. Does not nurture advancement in it's employees.

pros:
Vegetarian Organge Chicken

Fast Elevators.

I do like the drntal coverage.
cons:
Operating Room Childrens Hospital Management bully employees they no longer like. 

They give you a candy bar for taking a yearly survey.  If you dont tske the survey they Will  call you into the office and make you cry.

Sexual  Harassment issue december 2017.    

They  say racial slurs.

job_title: Graduate Student in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Friendly staff, regular hours, great experience, knowledgeable personnel, Sabbath hours observed, great balance with personal life. Ideal for student.
cons: The facility is fairly small, departments seem disconnected, lots of tedious meticulous work to perform.

job_title: Lab Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great people and consistent hours. I hear the benefit packages are competitive and worthwhile for full time employees.
cons: Benefits for part-time employees are out of sight expensive. Very difficult company to get into.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Loma Linda, CA
pros: The status of working for Loma Linda University is good to put on your resume, but that's about it.
cons: Low pay, no room for advancement, horrible management.  Not Christ-centered as the tagline would say.

review_title: I met the best people to work with here!
pros: Great clinical experience! Over time, good salary! Family centered care
cons: Working weekends and holidays. Long hours. 30 min break for 12 hours

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great company to work for.
cons: You never know if you job is totally secure.  Without warning, my position was eliminated and I was laid off.

pros: The people are very nice.
cons: Older equipment. Unless you're vegetarian food options kinda suck. With traffic around the area 30 min isn't quite long enough to go and get food.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Great work schedule with a lot of flexibility.
cons: Not much room to advance. Remain stagnant in same position.

pros: The people I'm blessed to work so closely with are helpful and kind.
cons: This job is on an as needed basis, so the hours are not quite part time.

pros: Great working environment, coworkers, benefits, and support of work/life balance.
cons: Not much room to move up in seniority, though it can depend on where you work.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Bernardino, CA
pros: Work/Life balance and community like feeling
cons: Need to pay a little more in order to be competitive with similar jobs

job_title: Research Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
pros: Lot of work experience in your desired field
cons: One may feel a little uncomfortable working in an Adventist Christian community especially if one comes from a different religious background.

pros: staff is friendly they make you feel so comfortable
cons: long hours and so much walking around which is normal

pros: Great place to work, terrific benefits, faith-based institution.

pros: it's a great place to gain experience.

job_title: HRM Assistant in Loma Linda, CA
